user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_ip_count_lock:
```c
static void
MHD_ip_count_lock (struct MHD_Daemon *daemon)
{
  mhd_assert (NULL == daemon->master);
#if defined(MHD_USE_POSIX_THREADS) || defined(MHD_USE_W32_THREADS)
  MHD_mutex_lock_chk_ (&daemon->per_ip_connection_mutex);
#else
  (void) daemon;
#endif
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
  mhd_assert (NULL == daemon->master);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: the call mhd_assert(NULL == daemon->master) does not call MHD_ip_count_lock directly or indirectly. mhd_assert is typically a macro/inline check (or calls an assert handler) and, absent evidence that it calls MHD_ip_count_lock, there is no recursion. (A violation would only occur if mhd_assert expanded or invoked code that transitively called MHD_ip_count_lock.)
